comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The exact identity of this machine is given on the fuselage side. It is a Friedrichshafen G.IV 1074/18. This machine was one of a batch of 30 license built by Daimler, hence the remark Daim. The whole designation is then Fdh G IV Daim 1074/18. These machines - at least this one - was delivered after the war and the picture gives it in an unfinished state. The G.IV (factory designation FF 61) was a strengthened G.III and was able to carry 10 booms of 100 kg each or the ultimate one bomb of 1000 kg ! The picture also gives some idea of the sparsity of tires at the end of the war in Germany as there are no tires visible.
